input:
Zenit Petersburg 2 - 0 Valencia

12:30 Caption: Domenico Criscito (Zenit St Petersburg) tries to slide the ball through to a teammate but it's well blocked by a defender. The ball goes out of play. Zenit are awarded a corner kick.
12:53 Event: Corner by Zenit Petersburg
12:57 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) swings in the corner, but it's comfortably cleared away.
13:07 Event: Offside by Zenit Petersburg
13:13 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) is adjudged to have been offside when making his run.

14:55 Caption: Goal! Artem Dzyuba provides Oleg Shatov (Zenit St Petersburg) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a strike into the middle of the goal. 1:0.
15:31 Event: Kick-off by Valencia
16:04 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg

16:28 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
16:28 Caption: Domenico Criscito (Zenit St Petersburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Svein Moen ignores the protests.
16:47 Event: Foul by Valencia
17:23 Caption: Andre Gomes (Valencia) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Svein Moen blows his whistle for an infringement.
17:32 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
18:00 Event: Ball out of play
18:08 Event: Throw-in by Zenit Petersburg
18:28 Event: Offside by Zenit Petersburg
18:41 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) is caught offside!

19:02 Event: Ball out of play
19:10 Event: Ball out of play
19:18 Event: Throw-in by Zenit Petersburg

20:35 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
20:48 Caption: A fine lofted pass into the box, sent by Domenico Criscito (Zenit St Petersburg), is intercepted by the opposition's defence.
21:25 Caption: Domenico Criscito (Zenit St Petersburg) tries to send a pass but it's blocked. The ball goes behind for a corner. Zenit will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
21:26 Event: Shots on target by Zenit Petersburg
21:27 Event: Ball out of play
21:53 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) steps up to take the corner, but the ball just sails in among the defenders.
21:54 Event: Corner by Zenit Petersburg

22:38 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
22:53 Caption: Zenit quickly take the free kick with a short pass.
23:11 Caption: Danny (Zenit St Petersburg) attempts to surprise the keeper with a shot from distance, but it lacks accuracy and goes high over the crossbar.

23:14 Event: Ball out of play
23:43 Event: Clearance by Valencia
23:56 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg

24:24 Event: Ball out of play
24:29 Event: Throw-in by Valencia

25:39 Event: Ball out of play

26:23 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) floats the free kick into the box, but it's easily cleared by the first man.
27:07 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg

28:00 Caption: Rafael Mir Vicente (Valencia) slams the ball towards the middle of the goal, but it fails to surprise Yuri Lodygin and he's equal to it.
28:01 Event: Shots on target by Valencia
28:24 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
28:39 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
28:52 Caption: Daniel Parejo (Valencia) attempts to find his teammate with a pass from outside the box, but the opposition's defence is quick to react and thwarts the attack. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Valencia.
28:55 Event: Ball out of play
29:15 Event: Corner by Valencia
29:15 Caption: Daniel Parejo (Valencia) steps up to take the corner. He launches the ball into the penalty area, but it only finds the head of an opposing player who clears the danger.
29:30 Caption: Rafael Mir Vicente (Valencia) finds himself free inside the box and pulls the trigger, but his effort is brilliantly stopped by one of the defending players. Good work from Valencia as they win a corner.
29:33 Event: Ball out of play
29:58 Event: Corner by Valencia
30:01 Caption: The corner from Daniel Parejo (Valencia) is intercepted by the defence.
30:18 Event: Shots on target by Zenit Petersburg
30:30 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) produces a lovely chip pass into the box, but one of the opposition players cuts it out.
31:14 Event: Foul by Valencia
31:58 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
32:00 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) takes the ball and sets it for the free kick.
32:01 Event: Shots on target by Zenit Petersburg
32:10 Caption: Danny (Zenit Petersburg) is flagged for offside.
32:31 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
33:23 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
33:32 Event: Ball out of play
33:41 Event: Throw-in by Zenit Petersburg
33:42 Event: Foul by Valencia
33:43 Event: Ball out of play
34:08 Caption: Svein Moen couldn't ignore the rough tackle by Joao Cancelo (Valencia) and blew his whistle. Zenit are given an advantage. They have a free kick.
34:17 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) swings in a promising cross from the free kick, but one of the defenders does a perfect job to avert the danger.
34:19 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
35:10 Event: Ball out of play
35:17 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
35:51 Caption: Artem Dzyuba received a sweet pass from Danny (Zenit St Petersburg), but the advance is stopped.
36:35 Caption: The game is interrupted now, Oleg Shatov (Zenit St Petersburg) picks up a knock and the physio has to come on.
37:44 Event: Ball out of play
37:49 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
38:05 Caption: Oleg Shatov (Zenit St Petersburg) seems to be alright and is okay to carry on.
38:22 Caption: A pass from Joao Cancelo (Valencia) is intercepted by Yuri Lodygin and the move breaks down.
40:22 Caption: Zenit play a few nice passes from player to player, but their possession doesn't last long as an opposition player intercepts a pass.
40:23 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
40:32 Caption: Neto (Zenit St Petersburg) is clearly asking for some medical attention with his painful gestures. The extent of his injury is yet to be discovered.
41:40 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
42:01 Caption: A precise cross towards the penalty spot was latched onto by Paco Alcacer (Valencia). He outjumped the defence and produced a decent header which went a whisker wide of the left post.
42:04 Event: Ball out of play
42:34 Event: Clearance by Zenit Petersburg
42:52 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
42:56 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
43:09 Event: Ball out of play
43:23 Caption: Daniel Parejo (Valencia) passes the ball onto Paco Alcacer, but one of the defenders dispossesses him. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Valencia.
43:34 Event: Corner by Valencia
43:42 Caption: Daniel Parejo swings in a cross from the corner, but Yuri Lodygin (Zenit St Petersburg) reads it well and gathers the ball.
43:52 Event: Ball out of play
44:06 Event: Clearance by Valencia
44:32 Event: Foul by Valencia
44:37 Event: Yellow card by Valencia
44:42 Caption: Rafael Mir Vicente (Valencia) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Svein Moen didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
45:17 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
45:21 Event: Shots off target by Zenit Petersburg
45:23 Event: Ball out of play
45:37 Caption: What a miskick by Danny (Zenit St Petersburg). He smashes a volley from long distance that goes into the stands.
47:06 Caption: The end of the first half.
47:59 Caption: Well, a decent first half here. It's certainly not boring, but not the best match either. Neither team was able to take the initiative and dominate the first half. Both the home and the away side are creating their opportunities using lightning-fast counter-attacks.

Second Half:
00:00 Event: Kick-off by Valencia
00:00 Caption: 2 min. of stoppage-time to be played.
00:01 Caption: Everything is set for the start of the second half.
00:36 Event: Shots off target by Zenit Petersburg
00:38 Event: Ball out of play
00:40 Caption: What a poor attempt! Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) drives another shot towards goal - this time from further out, but it couldn't have been worse if he had shot blindfolded. The ball goes yards wide of the left post.
00:54 Event: Clearance by Valencia
01:40 Event: Ball out of play
01:45 Caption: Paco Alcacer (Valencia) slaloms his way past challenges, but an opposing player does well to get the ball away. The referee signals a corner kick to Valencia.

02:49 Caption: Jose Gaya (Valencia) attempts to find the head of one of his teammates with a promising cross into the box, but a defender outjumps the attackers and averts the threat.

05:57 Caption: Valencia control the tempo of the game by exchanging some accurate short passes.
06:08 Caption: Joao Cancelo (Valencia) swings a cross into the box, but it's far too close to Yuri Lodygin, who smothers the ball.
07:29 Caption: Rafael Mir Vicente (Valencia) sends a long ball in, but Yuri Lodygin comfortably gathers the ball.

09:18 Event: Corner by Zenit Petersburg

09:31 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) takes the corner but it's cleared. It will be a corner kick for Zenit.
09:36 Event: Corner by Zenit Petersburg

10:07 Event: Offside by Valencia

10:28 Event: Substitution by Valencia

10:58 Event: Foul by Valencia

11:38 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
11:40 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
11:44 Event: Ball out of play
11:58 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
12:01 Caption: The free kick is delivered by Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) but it's not one of his best and is easily cleared.
12:17 Caption: Axel Witsel (Zenit St Petersburg) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Svein Moen has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle.
12:25 Event: Foul by Valencia
12:49 Caption: Svein Moen blows for a foul after Sofiane Feghouli (Valencia) was too aggressive in the battle for the ball. That's a free kick to Zenit.
13:12 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
13:14 Event: Ball out of play
13:18 Caption: What an opportunity! Ezequiel Garay (Zenit St Petersburg) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross into the box from the free kick, and he plants a header from near the penalty spot which goes a whisker wide of the left post.
13:33 Event: Clearance by Valencia
13:37 Event: Ball out of play
13:43 Event: Throw-in by Zenit Petersburg
14:49 Event: Ball out of play
14:50 Caption: Sofiane Feghouli (Valencia) attempts to set up his teammate with a scoring opportunity by chipping in a fine pass from the edge of the box, but one of the defenders intercepts his effort. The referee blows his whistle, Valencia are awarded a corner kick.
14:58 Event: Corner by Valencia
15:17 Caption: Santi Mina (Valencia) rolls the ball short to a teammate from the corner instead of sending a cross into the box.
15:40 Event: Ball out of play
15:41 Caption: Andre Gomes (Valencia) attempts to slip the ball through the defence, but is unable to find any of his teammates. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Zenit.

16:35 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg

17:02 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia

19:11 Caption: Here is a change. Igor Smolnikov is going off and Andre Villas-Boas gives the last tactical orders to Artur Yusupov (Zenit St Petersburg).
19:18 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
20:18 Caption: Flag up against Artem Dzyuba (Zenit Petersburg). He had space to move into behind the defence, but he went too soon.

21:17 Caption: Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Aymen Abdennour (Valencia) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

26:22 Caption: Sofiane Feghouli (Valencia) reacts well and displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick. He jumps high and produces a header which goes well wide of the right post.

28:28 Caption: A lofted cross from Daniel Parejo (Valencia) is unsuccessful as the opponent's defence quickly clears the ball out of the penalty area.
28:52 Event: Shots on target by Zenit Petersburg
28:53 Event: Goal by Zenit Petersburg
28:55 Caption: Goal! Danny puts the ball across the area and Artem Dzyuba (Zenit St Petersburg) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 2:0.
29:48 Event: Kick-off by Valencia
30:00 Event: Ball out of play
30:10 Caption: A cross into the box from Andre Gomes (Valencia) is cleared. Now Valencia have a corner.
30:18 Event: Corner by Valencia
30:23 Caption: Andre Gomes (Valencia) takes the corner but only sends it into a huddle of the defenders and one of them makes a good clearance.
30:25 Event: Ball out of play
31:27 Caption: Neto (Zenit St Petersburg) requires medical treatment, so the referee stops play and signals for the physio to come onto the pitch.
31:38 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
31:50 Event: Ball out of play

31:59 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
32:08 Caption: Neto (Zenit St Petersburg) has picked up a minor injury, but it looks like he will be able to continue.
32:11 Event: Yellow card by Zenit Petersburg
32:29 Caption: Svein Moen shows a yellow card to Axel Witsel (Zenit St Petersburg) for a tough tackle.
32:53 Event: Direct free-kick by Valencia
32:53 Event: Shots on target by Valencia
32:56 Caption: Danny (Zenit St Petersburg) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom left corner only for Jaume Domenech to dive and make a save.
33:14 Event: Foul by Valencia
33:28 Event: Substitution by Valencia

34:23 Event: Foul by Valencia

34:40 Caption: Ruben Vezo (Valencia) receives a red card after his awful challenge. He completely lost his temper and referee Svein Moen sends him off the pitch.
35:13 Caption: Zenit are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
35:49 Event: Direct free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
35:49 Event: Shots off target by Zenit Petersburg
35:50 Event: Ball out of play
35:54 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) takes the free kick from the edge of the box. His decent attempt goes narrowly wide of the left post.
36:01 Event: Clearance by Valencia
37:27 Event: Ball out of play
37:36 Event: Substitution by Zenit Petersburg
37:53 Event: Throw-in by Zenit Petersburg
38:04 Caption: Zenit seem to be finding their feet as they enjoy some possession. They are waiting for the right moment to create new attacking opportunities.
38:07 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
38:12 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
38:25 Caption: The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aleksander Ryazantsev (Zenit St Petersburg) replaces Oleg Shatov.
39:17 Event: Shots on target by Zenit Petersburg
39:36 Event: Offside by Valencia
39:58 Caption: Jaume Domenech blocks Aleksander Ryazantsev (Zenit St Petersburg)'s effort from the edge of the box.
40:00 Caption: Valencia are ruled offside.
40:04 Event: Substitution by Zenit Petersburg
40:17 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
40:29 Event: Shots on target by Zenit Petersburg
40:36 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
40:37 Caption: Andre Villas-Boas prepares a substitution. Neto is replaced by Aleksey Evseev (Zenit St Petersburg).
41:00 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
41:07 Event: Ball out of play
41:15 Event: Throw-in by Valencia
41:18 Caption: What a great touch by Aleksander Ryazantsev (Zenit St Petersburg) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the centre of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
41:22 Event: Foul by Valencia
41:57 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
42:14 Event: Foul by Valencia
42:14 Caption: Andre Gomes (Valencia) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Svein Moen blows his whistle for a foul.
42:18 Event: Indirect free-kick by Zenit Petersburg
42:21 Caption: Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) quickly takes the free kick with a short pass.
43:19 Event: Shots on target by Zenit Petersburg
43:35 Event: Foul by Zenit Petersburg
43:41 Event: Indirect free-kick by Valencia
44:06 Caption: Axel Witsel (Zenit St Petersburg) missed a great opportunity! He jumped for a cross and headed towards goal from the penalty spot, but the ball sailed well wide of the left post!
44:58 Caption: That didn't go as planned! Axel Witsel (Zenit St Petersburg) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort low towards the middle of the goal was too weak to get past Jaume Domenech, who easily kept it out.
46:22 Caption: Zenit are playing some nice combination football, sending it precisely from player to player, but a defender shows good anticipation and ends the move with a good block.
46:37 Caption: Great solo effort by Axel Witsel (Zenit St Petersburg) as he beats two defenders before unleashing a low drive from just outside of the box towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper is ready and makes a decent save.
47:53 Caption: Flag goes up against Hulk (Zenit St Petersburg) and the referee blows his whistle for offside.
48:15 Caption: The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
48:59 Caption: The performance from both sides could be described as average. There were only a few stirring moments and the fans probably expected more from this game. The home side dominated today's game. Both the home and the away side were creating their opportunities using lightning-fast counter-attacks.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
On a crisp day in Russia, Zenit Petersburg faced Valencia in a highly anticipated encounter that delivered a dramatic spectacle with numerous fouls, swift counter-attacks, and some crucial moments of brilliance, ultimately ending in a 2-0 victory for the home side, Zenit Petersburg. From the outset, the intensity was palpable as both teams battled for dominance.

The game kicked off with Zenit Petersburg immediately seizing control. The opening minutes were marked by aggressive play; just two minutes in, Zenit Petersburg committed a foul, setting the tone for a physically demanding match. Valencia responded with a precise indirect free-kick which led to their first shots on target, testing Zenit's goalkeeper early on. However, Zenit quickly regained possession and showed their intent, pressing forward.

By the third minute, Valencia's aggression matched Zenit's, resulting in a foul that set the stage for Zenit's first indirect free-kick. The subsequent exchange led to multiple ball-outs, throw-ins, and a noteworthy corner for Zenit around the five-minute mark. Despite the brief offside setback, Zenit continued to pressure, forcing Valencia to rely heavily on clearances to stem the wave of attacks.

Zenit maintained their offensive stance, leading to another goal attempt in the 14th minute, when a composed Artem Dzyuba sent a crisp pass to Oleg Shatov. Shatov exploited the opportunity with clinical precision, directing the ball right into the middle of the goal, putting Zenit 1-0 up. This goal invigorated the home team and their supporters alike.

Reacting to falling behind, Valencia resumed with renewed vigor but were consistently thwarted by Zenit’s resilient defense. Fouls continued to punctuate the game, highlighting the intense, sometimes desperate, physical duels on the pitch. Around the 16th minute, Zenit's Domenico Criscito earned a yellow card for a harsh tackle, reflecting the match's high tensions and uncompromising challenges.

Both teams continued to exchange possession, engaging in a series of throw-ins, offsides, and clearances. Zenit demonstrated their defensive tenacity, blocking Valencia's attempts to claw their way back, like Andre Gomes's thwarted effort. On the same note, creative plays from Zenit’s Hulk helped keep the pressure on Valencia's defense, although they were often nullified by Valencia’s timely interceptions.

Valencia's players made attempts to break Zenit's rhythm with crosses into the penalty area, but Zenit's defense held firm. Paco Alcacer and Rafael Mir Vicente had their moves intercepted by the vigilant Zenit defenders. Geared towards retaining their lead, Zenit focused on counter-attacks, often led by Hulk’s powerful runs and passes.

The second half introduced a tactical approach by both teams, with Valencia looking to break down Zenit’s defense, and Zenit aiming to consolidate their lead through swift counter-attacks. Valencia kicked off but soon found themselves disrupted by Zenit’s persistent pressure. Zenit's Hulk continued to take shots on goal, one of which came close early in the half but veered off target, much to his frustration.

Valencia made several changes to their lineup, bringing on substitutes like Santi Mina to invigorate their attack. However, Zenit quickly adapted to these changes, maintaining their defensive organization and disrupting Valencia's attacking flow. Joao Cancelo and Andre Gomes attempted to orchestrate Valencia’s plays, but Zenit proved too resilient, intercepting and clearing dangerous balls with aplomb.

In the 59th minute, Hulk’s corner kicks created havoc in Valencia’s penalty area, displaying Zenit’s attacking prowess despite the rigorous defense put up by Valencia. Zenit took advantage of such set-pieces to keep their opponents on the back foot, and continued efforts to exploit these opportunities bore fruit.

By the 65th minute, Zenit made a substitution with Igor Smolnikov making way for Artur Yusupov, following Valencia's inclusion of substitute Danilo for Enzo Perez. This revitalized Zenit’s midfield, ensuring they could sustain their attacking threat while suppressing Valencia’s attempts at a breakthrough.

The defining moment of the match came in the 73rd minute, when Zenit’s Danny controlled a precision cross near the goal, swiftly passing it to an unmarked Artem Dzyuba. Dzyuba, demonstrating impeccable positioning, tapped the ball into an empty net, extending Zenit's lead to 2-0. This goal not only highlighted Zenit’s strategic efficiency but also deflated Valencia's morale, making their comeback attempt even more daunting.

Still, Valencia did not relent and continued to chase the game. However, Zenit’s tactical discipline and effective man-marking prevented any significant threats. The match saw a flurry of fouls and free-kicks, with Zenit expertly managing the game's tempo to their advantage. In the 76th minute, Artur Yusupov received a yellow card for a trip, another testament to the game's fiercely contested nature.

As the minutes ticked away, Valencia's frustration became more evident. A red card for Ruben Vezo following a reckless challenge in the 79th minute further dampened their hopes, reducing them to ten men and weakening their defense against Zenit’s probing attacks.

The closing stages saw Zenit manage the game efficiently. Andre Villas-Boas capitalized on Zenit's composure by making strategic substitutions, including Aleksey Evseev replacing Neto, injecting fresh legs into the side to maintain their dominance. Axel Witsel and Aleksander Ryazantsev continued to create chances, but some efforts were stifled by the opposition or missed narrowly.

Valencia’s sporadic attempts to push forward were met with stiff resistance from Zenit’s organized backline. Axel Witsel, exemplifying Zenit’s work ethic, made crucial interceptions and tried to push forward, testing Valencia’s resolve until the final minutes. 

The referee’s whistle signaled the end of the contest, sealing a comprehensive 2-0 victory for Zenit Petersburg. Their disciplined defense, effective counter-attacks, and clinical finishing ensured they emerged victorious in a match characterized by physicality, tactical battles, and decisive moments. The fans departed with the satisfaction of seeing their team execute a well-rounded and gritty performance to secure the win against a resilient Valencia side.
